Alpha Phi Omega
ICDC 2016

Welcome to the Interchapter Dance Competition 2016 - a Tradition.

5PM, Saturday, April 23, 2016 at UCSD PC Ballrooms

Register Here

More

History

This is Rho Pi's largest, fellowship-style Interchapter event, held in Spring Quarter. The first Dance Comp was created by Fiona Cudiamat in Spring 2004. While Sections 1 and 2 are the main participants, brothers from Section 4 often attend and on certain occasions perform.

All of the profits go to the charity chosen by the planner of the event. Formerly the Vice President Admin, the Interchapter Chair now plans and arranges Dance Comp ever year. The Dance Comp Chairs of Rho Pi are in charge of forming the team, coordinating choreographers and arranging practices. In 2007, the winning Chapter received a 6ft. tall paddle, which is now passed on the winning team every year. The first place winners are honored with a small plaque placed on the paddle, with their Chapter's name and the year of the Competition.

We encourage all chapters of Alpha Phi Omega to come by and compete or support your fellow brothers every year!

Next

ICDC 2016 Charity: San Diego Rescue Mission

Every year, we ask for a $5 registration fee from all participants and spectators of ICDC. All proceeds and donations will go to this year's charity, the San Diego Rescue Mission.

Their mission: The San Diego Rescue Mission believes in the inherent worth of every homeless man, woman, and child. Our mission is to spread the good news of salvation through Christ by serving the needs of the poor, addicted, abused, and homeless, thus improving the quality of their lives. Our programs provide the rehabilitation and discipleship that allow us to achieve this mission, leading to positive, lasting change â€“ and creating better lives for those we serve, their families, and the community as a whole.

Today, the organization provides over 12,500 nights of shelter, over 37,000 hot meals and over 82,000 hours of education, work training and rehabilitation on a monthly basis.

Learn more here: http://www.sdrescue.org/

Registration

Each chapter has their own respective forms, please fill them out accordingly. A $5 fee is required for your registration to be confirmed. After completing the form, you will receive an automated e-mail stating your registration as received and pending.
